== We archive wikis, from Wikipedia to tiniest wikis ==

There are [http://wikiindex.org thousands] [http://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Sites_using_MediaWiki/en of] [http://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Sites_using_MediaWiki/multilingual wikis] in the Internet. Everyday some of them are no longer publicly available and, due to lack of [http://code.google.com/p/wikiteam/downloads/list?can=1 backups], lost. Many people download tons of media files (music, books, etc) from the Internet, implementing a kind of distributed backup. Wikis, most of them under free licenses, disappear from time to time because nobody grabbed a copy of them. That is a shame that we would like to solve.

The last *news*!

Time for archiving all of them! Subscribe you to the [http://groups.google.com/group/wikiteam-discuss mailing list] and offer you to archive all wikis in a country. Thanks!

== What can you do? ==
You can do *a lot of* things:
  * Read our [FAQ]
  * Download our [http://code.google.com/p/wikiteam/source/checkout scripts and software]
  * Read our [Tutorial] and backup your favorite wiki. Send us a copy of the backup if you want!
  * Download some [http://code.google.com/p/wikiteam/downloads/list?can=1 backups] of wikis
  * [http://code.google.com/p/wikiteam/issues/list Report a bug or request a feature]
  * Use the backups to [Research research] how wiki communities evolve
  * Subscribe to the mailing lists: [http://groups.google.com/group/wikiteam-discuss general discussion] and [http://groups.google.com/group/wikiteam-developers developer discussion]

== Research ==
Are you a *researcher*? If you have conducted any [Research research] about wikis using our software or the backups we made available, we would be glad to hear from your experience. [Research Contact us].

== People using WikiTeam tools ==
If you use WikiTeam tools to back up wikis and you host the files, contact us, we will be glad to add a link here:
  * http://mirrors.sdboyd56.com/WikiTeam/index.html

== Licenses ==
This project contain a lot of material. *Be careful with the licenses*.
  * The [http://code.google.com/p/wikiteam/source/checkout source code] is GPL v3
  * Every [http://code.google.com/p/wikiteam/downloads/list?can=1 backup] of every wiki has its own license. Visit the site of the wiki and search for the license of the texts and images. Read more in our [FAQ]

== Note ==
Due to lack of space, we do not offer image dumps in Google Code. *The dumps only include the texts of the wikis.* Although you can run the script and generate your own backup which would contain all the texts and images.

== Contact ==
If you want to *contact with the WikiTeam community*, you can do it:
  * For bug reports, new features requests, notices about new wikis to backup: http://code.google.com/p/wikiteam/issues/list
  * General discussion about WikiTeam tools and help for new users: http://groups.google.com/group/wikiteam-discuss
  * Developers discussion about bugs, patches, features: http://groups.google.com/group/wikiteam-developers
  * There is a social IRC channel in Efnet: irc://efnet/wikiteam

Also, [http://code.google.com/p/wikiteam/w/list every wiki page] allows to send comments.

If you need an e-mail, you can send your messages to emijrp@gmail.com
